name: Los Suenos Marriott Ocean & Golf Resort

reviews.text: We had booked a mountain view at the hotel using my husband's Marriott points. When we checked in, they informed us they were upgrading us to a better room. I couldn't believe the room they put us in--a suite overlooking the ocean, with each room having cathedral ceilings and a private balcony. Just gorgeous! We stayed there two days and truly enjoyed the luxury. I had been warned that the beach there was not the best (which it isn't), but the resort makes up for it. The pool was wonderful, with live entertainers and a swim up bar/restaurant with reasonable food. We didn't actually give that much business to the hotel, as we never made it to the casino or ate in any of the restaurants (other than one in-room dining experience). The room, however, was to die for (and I have stayed in lots of very nice hotels). All of the staff we dealt with were quite friendly. I can't speak to the normal rooms at the resort, but we truly had a wonderful experience there. Would highly recommend the resort. Also had a great breakfast one morning at a nearby high-end luxury B&B--?Carreta. Great views and a really relaxing breakfast.
reviews.title: Relax in luxury
Beautiful Resort
reviews.text: Los Suenos is a beautiful resort with a hacienda flair. If you are looking for nightlife, it is not the place for you. It is a wonderful venue for quiet evenings after a day of adventure touring CR. The breakfast buffet was delicious and extensive. The staff was accommodating and friendly. Poolside service was slow and nonexistent at times, but the swim up bar made up for it. Cocktails at US prices. We didn't eat at the restaurants as we preferred dining in Jaco and experiencing local cuisine. Our favorite was the Taco Bar that serves fresh fish tacos with a wonderful salad bar. Spa services were more expensive than I pay in Washington, DC. Beautiful golf course, although we are not golfers. I had to visit the local clinic on our 1st day which was located outside of the resort entrance. Very nice doctor and antibiotics at the pharmacy in town are cheap and plentiful. Tours are expensive so we opted to rent a car and make the adventure ourselves. Roads are poor and signs minimal, so bring a map. 90% of the people in the resort areas speak English. In the smaller towns they don't. Please respect their country and language and learn some basic Spanish or at least bring a translation book. If you are looking for a beach vacation, this one is only for surfers. Not pretty, but rocky and black sand. No need for nice clothing, comfortable t-shirts and shorts, old sneakers and sandals will do. We would definitely stay here again. The resort is Americanized for us spoiled Americans, but the country is not. Go with an open mind and plan on alot of physical activity.

reviews.title: Great resort in a Great area
reviews.text: If you like resorts, you will love Los Suenos. The service and facilities are excellent. The hotel organized excursions throughout the area and made it really easy to get to Jaco and any other places around Costa Rica.

reviews.title: Great Trip!!!!!!
reviews.text: If you are not a resort lover, however, you would probably be better served finding hotels in the cities you want to be in. Once you are at the resort, you are pretty much stuck there. There are two restraunts in the resort, and two in the resort owned marina. If you want to leave the resort, you need some sort of transportation because there is really nothing else within walking distance.

reviews.title: Loved Casa Mono Loco
reviews.text: The hotel restaurants were very good, but very expensive. A buffet dinner for two with two glasses of wine cost us over $100. Eating in Jaco was ridiculously cheap in comparison - however, good eating places were hard to find.
We just came back from Los Sueños and had a wonderful time. We were really impressed with this hotel. The service was great. The morning breakfast was really goodl.
reviews.title: Very nice resort hotel
Americanizes Costa Rican Resort
reviews.text: The room was immaculate and everything at Marriott Los Sueños.The pool area is fantastic. It´s a great place to stay.

reviews.title: Too All the Critics, Lighten Up, This is a Beauatiful Hotel!
reviews.text: After we booked this resort, I read some of the reviews and found a few of them a bit unnerving. I decided to place my trust in the positive reviews, and fortunately, was not at all disappointed but rather very impressed. Short and sweet...A wonderful resort with more to do in a week than you could possilbly fit in. Numerous excursions easily booked at the hotel for a day or half day. Beautiful huge free-form pool. Swimming in the ocean was fun...and the brown sand washes away the same as the light brown...it's not dirt as I've read in other reviews. The rooms and architecture are first rate. The most American aspect of the hotel are the guest. So don't let the "it's an American hotel" steer you away. Go and Enjoy!

reviews.title: Exactly what I Expected
reviews.text: My husband and I, along with my 3 year old daughter just returned from Los Suenos Marriott. The hotel was exactly what I expected in terms of great service! Everyone was friendly, and helpful. The resort is beautiful, and the grounds are well kept. I loved the fact that Iguanas roamed freely through the resort. This resort is kid friendly, and has a kid clubhouse with activities. My daughter loved the clubhouse, and the kiddie swimming pool. The food was very good, although expensive. I was not surprised by this, as I had read other trip advisor reviews from guests who stayed at this hotel. I did appreciate that a full breakfast buffet was included in the cost of my package. I am a big breakfast eater and I enjoyed it a lot. I did spend extra money tipping for good service.
We did go on a couple of tours which were very expensive.
reviews.title: American Oasis in Costa Rica
If you want to experience American culture in Costa Rica, this is your hotel
reviews.text: Drawbacks: we did go during the rainy season, so it did rain almost every day. Yes, there were a few small ants in our room. I had requested an ocean view room and unfortunately, did not get one. We got the mountain view room which was average, but comfortable. During check-out I reviewed our bill and noticed that we were overcharged about $200 in charges, that had to be removed from our bill. The resort is about 2 hours from the airport in San Jose.

reviews.title: Los Suenos Marriott was excellent!
reviews.text: I had a good time visiting Costa Rica and would return.
We recently stayed at the Marriott Los Suenos Resort. The resort is located near Jaco Beach, approximately 1.5 hours from San Jose.
reviews.title: Marriott Los Suenos Resort
Beautiful resort
reviews.text: The resort is secluded and lushly landscaped with private golf course, ocean views and what seemed to be condominium residences.

reviews.title: loved the marriott los suenos hotel
reviews.text: The room hotel was very beautiful, maintained and well equipped. We enjoyed our use of the golf course, spa, swimming pool and dining facilities.

reviews.title: Incredible Vacation
reviews.text: Despite the beauty of the hotel, we found the service to be somewhat under par. We paid around $400/night including taxes and expected top notch service. The bell staff was somewhat aloof, the front desk was not very professional and did not have acceptable answers to our inquiries.
In general I was disappointed with the service, but that may just be our own bad luck. Overall I was impressed with the beauty of the hotel and facilities and would certainly return.
reviews.title: Why Stay Here When There Are Beautiful Places With Beaches?
